alert.note: Alert for Appling; Bacon; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 09 at 1:30PM EST until January 09 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a * Tornado Warning for... East central Bacon County in southeastern Georgia... Northwestern Wayne County in southeastern Georgia... Eastern Appling County in southeastern Georgia... * Until 200 PM EST. * At 130 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 9 miles southwest of Surrency, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Surrency around 135 PM EST. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
